issue.title: Center the grid inside the window
issue.body:
Currently alacritty always puts the grid at the top-left position of the
window. The only distance to the top-left window border is set by the
padding in the config.

However the grid always has a fixed size, and if a cell doesn't
completely fit the screen anymore, the padding at the bottom right
window corner can be significantly bigger than the padding at the top
left.

To fix this whenever there is more space left and there would usually be
a bigger padding at the bottom right, the space is now split up and
added to the padding.

This should always center the grid inside the window and make sure all
borders have the same padding from the text area.

This screenshot shows how it has been until now:
![Before](https://u.teknik.io/kRJwg.png)

Here is how it looks now:
![After](https://u.teknik.io/m4puV.png)

This fixes #1065.

This also solves a few minor clippy issues.

body:
I found that I had the same reaction after updating, but my values for the padding were just much too large now, by changing them from 5 to 1 everything looks pretty good (see #1775). The biggest drawback to the centered view (other than possible preference) is how it looks when it's being zoomed. Whereas before text would grow from the top-left somewhat uniformly, now the text jumps around a lot more. This will probably be enough for me to turn the centering off. The same kind of visual jumping was the cause of this issue while resizing a window.

To both fix the window resize (tiling WM movement) issue, and partially fix the zooming issue the option to only center the X axis could be added. This would match my needs I believe.

I think that adding config options for dynamic x and dynamic y padding would go a bit far.

I'm fine with enabling or disabling this feature completely. But it seems like that's going down a bit far of a rabbit hole, when most users are unlikely to need such complex padding configuration.

Well TBH, I feel most users (wheather they really notice it or not) will be unhappy with the jumping. If trying both x and y booleans separately is too complex I'd personally argue for disabled being the default. I might try hacking in just disabling the Y and seeing how much better things are. I suspect it's worth it.

I'd love some more feedback on this topic. I personally can't stand it when things are completely unaligned the way they were previously. But I don't have a general picture.

Probably also a case where a vocal minority might complicate getting proper feedback. But generally the complete on/off switch shouldn't be too far out there.
Note that as far as I can tell at first glance, neither XTerm, URxvt nor Termite do padding at all. Just as an indicator for a reasonable default that doesn't surprise users.

issue.title: Add option for dynamic padding
issue.body:
This adds the `window.dynamic_padding` option which allows disabling the
dynamic spread of additional padding around the grid's content.

This fixes #1778.

I'm not quite sure yet if this should be `true` or `false` by default. If someone
has an opinion on this, please leave a comment here.

body:
I've created a PR which implements this feature, I think that should be good enough:
https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/pull/1780
